TAKE FOR GRANTED.Definition: consider something as an unquestionable certainty

NUTMEG.Definition: the fruit of a tropical tree used as a spice

PRESERVE.Definition: something that is reserved only for a particular group

SPRINKLE.Definition: drop a few small pieces of something

BARK.Definition: the hard outer material covering a tree

ROOT.Definition: the part of a plant or tree that grows down into the earth

VINDALOO CURRY.Definition: a spicy sauce popular in India

SWEAT.Definition: cause the salty liquid from the body to pass through the skin

SWEATING.Definition: causing the salty liquid from the body to pass through the skin

MUMMIFIED.Definition: preserved or saved from rotting away using special oils

SALARY.Definition: a fixed amount of money paid to an employee

BORDERLESS.Definition: without being limited by borders or by a state's area of control

AFFORDABILITY.Definition: the ability to be bought related to its cost

MANUAL LABOURER.Definition: a common worker whose job involves working with the hands

MANUAL LABOURERS.Definition: common people whose job involves working with the hands

OUT OF REACH.Definition: beyond the ability to buy it

SANK.Definition: went to the bottom of the sea

STATUS SYMBOL.Definition: something that shows someone has money or importance

SHOWING OFF.Definition: showing something in order to attract attention

FEUDAL.Definition: belonging to a social system controlled by rich people of high social rank

ARISTOCRATS.Definition: people belonging to the higher social class

WAGES.Definition: the money earned by an employee

HARVESTING.Definition: the activity of gathering and collecting spices

FERTILE.Definition: capable of producing lots of plants

BLOW.Definition: a hard hit or something that causes difficulty

HOTSPOT.Definition: a place where fighting is likely to happen

INHABITANTS.Definition: the people who lived in that place

BRUTALLY.Definition: in a cruel and violent way

MONOPOLY.Definition: the exclusive control of a trade

GO DOWN.Definition: be remembered in a particular way

SWAPS.Definition: acts of giving something and be given something else

AFFORDABLE.Definition: able to be bought, not expensive

EXCEPTIONS.Definition: things that are excluded from something that is said

EXOTIC.Definition: unusual and exciting because they come from a far away place

LUXURY.Definition: a state of great and expensive comfort

BOUTIQUES.Definition: businesses that sell expensive and fashionable products
